text: Kind of bonkers. The only players in there could only be algotraders, right?  Even with a drone feed or court siding, you’re going to be struggling to interpret and act. Also, delays need a think: 5 second delay = about a third of a race at 260m. 1/6th of the race at 500m…

elements.text: Kind of bonkers. The only players in there could only be algotraders, right?  Even with a drone feed or court siding, you’re going to be struggling to interpret and act. Also, delays need a think: 5 second delay = about a third of a race at 260m. 1/6th of the race at 500m…

text: For comparison, the Epsom dash - “the fastest 5f race in the World” - has a record just shy of 54 seconds - I need to check what the in-play liquidity has been like for that, but I expect it’s something a lot of people stay away from for obvious reasons. The record for dogs at 260m is below 15 seconds. Even slow greyhounds in BAGS races are consistently running faster than horses do downhill in the Dash because of acceleration ability.

text:
Hi, Betfair used to publish a file providing mapping relationship between an eventId and its competition and update it from time to time. This url does not work any more: <https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Additional+Information#AdditionalInformation-Soccer>

Does anybody here know if there is a new url?

elements.text: Hi, Betfair used to publish a file providing mapping relationship between an eventId and its competition and update it from time to time. This url does not work any more:
Does anybody here know if there is a new url?

text: Check out <https://github.com/mberk/betfairmappings|https://github.com/mberk/betfairmappings> (although it needs a refresh)

attachments.text: Map Betfair selection IDs to runner names, market IDs to competition names, etc.
attachments.title: mberk/betfairmappings

text:
I haven’t seen any evidence of anyone on there making enough for full time? I think the aus team have done a fantastic job with the ‘hub’ and the competitions / events / data, Betfair uk could certainly learn a few things! 

However this has meant the discord has attracted those new to the game (good) but also those that have been doing it a while but not made it although more than happy to offer [terrible] advice.

text:
Yeah you did - but in case anyone missed it here's the summary:

1: You've got to have value.

2: Don't "green up", it breaches 1.

3: If your bot does good with small stakes but crashes when you increase your stakes you can fix it by reducing your stakes again.

That's basically it.

elements.text:
Yeah you did - but in case anyone missed it here's the summary:

1: You've got to have value.

2: Don't "green up", it breaches 1.

3: If your bot does good with small stakes but crashes when you increase your stakes you can fix it by reducing your stakes again.

That's basically it.
